explanation: Global Witness is primarily a non-profit organization focused on environmental protection, transparency in natural resource management, and human rights. The organization works to expose corruption in the oil, gas, and mining industries, but it does not engage in fossil fuel production, trade, or advocacy directly. Instead, it critiques and campaigns against the practices of fossil fuel companies.

Shell plc is a major British multinational oil and gas company engaged in all aspects of the oil and gas industry, including exploration, production, refining, and distribution. Its direct involvement in the fossil fuel sector and its significant operations in oil and gas make it a fossil fuel organization.

Oxford University is primarily an educational institution focused on research and teaching. It does not engage in the exploration, extraction, or trading of fossil fuels officially, although there has been historical involvement in fossil fuel investments which it has since sought to address and reduce. Nonetheless, its primary mission is education and research, placing it squarely outside the category of fossil fuel companies or trade groups.

SOCAR is the state-owned oil and gas company of Azerbaijan, involved directly in the exploration, extraction, refining, and distribution of fossil fuels such as oil and natural gas. The documents detail its extensive operations in these areas, making SOCAR a clear fossil fuel organization.
